chapter.title: Param Functions
chapter.para: These functions are mainly used to generate pairing parameters. There are several types of pairings, which, like vitamins, are labelled with capital letters roughly in the order of discovery. Not all known pairing types are implemented in PBC.
Type A is best when speed is the main concern, and type D is a good choice when elements should be short, though type F has even short elements but is unfortunately slower.

section.title: Type A
section.para: Pairings on type A curves are the fast and ought to be used where the main concern is efficiency. Typically, r should be about 160 bits long and q about 512 bits. In this case, elements of groups G1 and G2 take 512 bits to represent.
The file param/a.param contains parameters for a type A pairing suitable for cryptographic use.
The a_param_t data type holds parameters for a type A pairing.
